srgcwscs.RandCWS

srgcwscs.RandCWS Class Reference

This class encapsulates the Randomized Generalized Clarke & Wright Savings heuristic for the extended CVRP. The RGCWS algorithm introduces randomness in the edge-selection process of the Generalized CWS heuristic. More...

Detailed Description

This class encapsulates the Randomized Generalized Clarke & Wright Savings heuristic for the extended CVRP. The RGCWS algorithm introduces randomness in the edge-selection process of the Generalized CWS heuristic.

Authors:
Angel A. Juan, Juan Carlos Cruz, Marcos Fernandez Callejo

Member Function Documentation

boolean srgcwscs.RandCWS.checkMergingConditions ( Route  iR,
Route  jR,
Edge  ijEdge,
Test  atest 
)

Check if it is feasible to merge two given routes.

Remarks:
Controls that any constraint is violated (Routes are not the same, Both nodes are exterior in their respective nodes, demand after merging can be covered by a single node)
Parameters:
iR - Route First route to be merged
jR - Route second route to be merged
ijEdge - Edge which connects two nodes
aTest - Test Characteristics of the test being run
Returns:
boolean - True if the two routes can be merged without breaking any condition
See also:
void edgeSelectionRoutingMerging(Node depot,int [] positions, Edge[] effList,Test test, Solution aSolution)

Edge srgcwscs.RandCWS.getEdgeDepotNode ( Route  aRoute,
Node  externalNode 
)

Gets the edge directly connected to the depot.

Remarks:
Return null in no edges was found for the given nodes
Parameters:
aRoute - Route Representation of a route formed by a set of edges starting and and ending at the depot
externalNode - Node connected to the depot
Returns:
Edge - Edge connecting the two nodes. Null if any edge was found for the two nodes.
See also:
void edgeSelectionRoutingMerging(Node depot,int [] positions, Edge[] effList,Test test, Solution aSolution)

void srgcwscs.RandCWS.mergingManager ( Route  bigRoute,
Route  smallRoute,
Edge  newEdge,
Solution  aSolution 
)

Coordinates the merging process, reduces the timing used for coordinates routes and new edge direction.

Remarks:
the edge and small route will have the same direction as the biggest route.
Parameters:
bigRoute - Route big one route among two routes
smallRoute - Small one route among two routes
newEdge - Edge connecting the new routes to be merged
aSolution - Solution new set of routes to be updated
See also:
void edgeSelectionRoutingMerging(Node depot,int [] positions, Edge[] effList,Test test, Solution aSolution)

void srgcwscs.RandCWS.reverseRoute ( Route  aRoute  ) 

Reverse the route direction, reversing all edges in route.

Remarks:
Given aRoute (e.g. 0 -> 2 -> 6 -> 0), reverses the order of its nodes (e.g. 0 -> 6 -> 2 -> 0)
Parameters:
aRoute - Route Representation of a route formed by a set of edges starting and and ending at the depot
See also:
void edgeSelectionRoutingMerging(Node depot,int [] positions, Edge[] effList,Test test, Solution aSolution)

boolean  useRandomSelection 
)

Core method to solve the VRP according to a given characteristics, with a set of elements and returning a collection of routes.

Parameters:
effList - Edge[] array of edges connecting nodes
useRandomSelection - use Random selection for solving VRP
Returns:
Solution - Set of nodes that resolves the VRP problem
